getConversationTitle().Description: Return the title to be displayed on this conversation. Can be null and should be for one-on-one conversations

Parameters: CharSequence: Title displayed for this conversation.
setConversationTitle(java.lang.CharSeque.Description: Sets the title to be displayed on this conversation. This should only be used for group messaging and left unset for one-on-one conversations.

getMessages().Description: Gets the list of Message objects that represent the notification

getUserDisplayName().Description: Returns the name to be displayed for any replies sent by the user

ClassDesc: Helper class for generating large-format notifications that include multiple back-and-forth messages of varying types between any number of people. In order to get a backwards compatible behavior, the app needs to use the v7 version of the notification builder together with this style, otherwise the user will see the normal notification view. Use @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#MessagingStyle#setConversationTitle_E@ to set a conversation title for group chats with more than two people. This could be the user-created name of the group or, if it doesn't have a specific name, a list of the participants in the conversation. Do not set a conversation title for one-on-one chats, since platforms use the existence of this field as a hint that the conversation is a group. This class is a "rebuilder": It attaches to a Builder object and modifies its behavior, like so:
